Strong Profitability:NALCO achieved its highest-ever net profit of ₹5,325 crore in FY 2024-25, a 158% year-on-year increase. This was supported by the highest-ever revenue from operations of ₹16,788 crore, a 28% year-on-year growth.

Q1 2025-26 Performance:The company continued its strong performance into the first quarter of FY 2025-26, reporting a 77% rise in net profit to ₹1,064 crore compared to ₹601 crore in the corresponding period of the previous year.

Production Expansion:NALCO was actively pursuing expansion projects to increase its production capacity and achieve the "Maharatna" status.

Smelter Capacity:The company planned to increase its smelter capacity by 0.5 million tonnes per annum and add 1080 MW of power generation capacity, with investments of ₹17,163 crore and ₹12,000 crore respectively.

Pottangi Bauxite Mines:NALCO aimed to start operations at its Pottangi bauxite mines by June of the following year. This mine has a production capacity of 3.5 million tonnes per annum and estimated reserves of 111 million tonnes. The company planned to invest ₹1,961 crore in this project.

Refinery Expansion:The 5th stream expansion of the Alumina refinery was underway.

Focus on Efficiency and Cost Optimization:NALCO emphasized enhancing efficiency and optimizing costs to maintain competitive pricing.

Technological Advancement:The company planned to integrate artificial intelligence into various processes to reduce reliance on manpower.

Product Diversification:NALCO aimed to diversify its product range.

Environmental Responsibility:NALCO implemented eco-friendly bauxite transport systems and achieved 98% blast-free mining. The company also received a 5-Star Rating for its C&N block and South block bauxite mines. Furthermore, NALCO expanded its green initiatives by planting 174,369 trees in FY25 (a 19% increase year-on-year) and rehabilitating 15.7 hectares of mined-out areas with plantations. The company operates 198 MW of wind power capacity and 1020 kWp of rooftop solar, with further expansions planned.

Rising Aluminium Demand:The demand for aluminium in India was projected to grow at 1.5 times the GDP rate, reaching 7 to 8 million tonnes annually by 2030, driven by infrastructure development, power network expansion, and the transportation sector.

Strong Domestic Sales:NALCO recorded its highest-ever Q1 domestic sales of alumina and aluminium. Alumina exports surged by 209%, and domestic alumina sales climbed by 190%.

August 21, 2025:NALCO's stock price closed at 191.0, a slight decrease from the previous close of 192.22.

Analyst Rating (May 23, 2025):ICICI Securities downgraded NALCO to "HOLD" with a target price of ₹190, citing expected lower alumina and aluminium prices and constrained volume growth.
